definition: flat/(coll.) to beat (sb) up/old variant of 匾[bian3]
to undertake/to carry/to shoulder/to take responsibility
picul (100 catties, 50 kg)/two buckets full/carrying pole and its load/classifier for loads carried on a shoulder pole
Altair and its two adjacent stars

sentences.english: The carrying pole creaked under the load.
This paper also analyzes the cost and key technological measures for steel carrying pole method.
sentences.chinese: 总结了钢扁担梁更换支座的关键技术措施。

sentences.english: The shoulder pole creaked under the weight of the luggage.
sentences.chinese: 行李压得扁担嘎吱嘎吱直响。

sentences.english: The shoulder pole bent with heavy load.
Then, straightened up, seize the pole hook up to mention.
sentences.chinese: 然后，直起身，抓住扁担勾往上提。

sentences.english: I saw the bright Altair and the two adjacent stars in the sky in an unclouded Summer night.
sentences.chinese: 晴朗的夏夜，我看见了明亮的扁担星。

sentences.english: Workers carry building materials in buckets at the end of long poles.
sentences.chinese: 工人们用扁担和筐挑运建筑材料。

sentences.english: A street vender of foods with her carrying pole in Bangkok.
sentences.chinese: 挑著扁担在曼谷街头卖食物的小贩。

sentences.english: The carrying-pole broke with a crack.

definition: a basket carried on the back
well bucket/pail made of bamboo strips
